text: Lawrence Patrick David Gillick (born August 22, 1937) is an American professional baseball executive. He was the general manager of four MLB teams: the Toronto Blue Jays (1978–1994), Baltimore Orioles (1996–1998), Seattle Mariners (2000–2003), and Philadelphia Phillies (2006–2008). He was born in Chico, California. In 2011, he was elected into the National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:Living people Category:Businesspeople from California Category:Sportspeople from California
title: Pat Gillick
